_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

It has been and will continue to be the policy of Hershey Creamery Company, Inc. to strive to provide the safest and most efficient place to work.  The operations of the Hershey Creamery Company shall be conducted with the highest regard for the safety and health of its employees.  It is therefore reasonable to expect every employee to accept the responsibility of being a conscious safe worker and to commonly practice safe work habits while on the job and work place. Thus to accomplish this mission, and a successful safety program, with the active cooperation of every person/employee is absolutely essential.

All employees are part takers of this team effort with the Hershey Creamery Company, Inc..  For a team to operate efficiently, it must be structured and disciplined, following the leadership guidance of the management leadership, while working together, safely, towards a common goal. Each team member must be responsible for their own actions and should constantly exercise care and good judgment on the job and at the work place.  Every employee regardless of job reasonability and/or job description is to adopt a "think before you act" safety prospective. Because an unconscious action or act could cause a mortality to yourself or others.

In order to accomplish the above safety goals the Hershey Creamery Company has implemented a Process Safety Management Plan (PSM) for its Ammonia Refrigeration Process.  The PSM Plan includes both an Emergency Action Plan and an Integrated Contingency Plan.  The objective of the PSM Plan is to prevent unwanted releases of hazardous chemicals that could expose employees and other to serious hazards.  To control these types of hazards, our PSM Team have developed and implemented a proactive initiative within our workforce that maintains the program as envisioned by OSHA.

Over the pase five years we have had no reportable releases of ammonia, however, some non-reportable releases have been handled by our inhouse

Emergency Response Team.  Should a reportable release take place our Team will coordinate with local emergency responders as outlined in our Emergency Action Plan.

At present there are no planed changes to our PSM Program.  However, our plan does include periodic reviews and a management of change policy that will insure that proper changes are made as required.
